remarks: The determinant function is alternating regarding rows: if a matrix has two identical rows, its determinant is 0.  Corollary 4.9 in [Lang] p. 515.  (Contributed by SO, 10-Jul-2018.)  (Proof shortened by AV, 23-Jul-2018.)
statement:
mdetralt.d $e |- D = ( N maDet R ) $.
mdetralt.a $e |- A = ( N Mat R ) $.
mdetralt.b $e |- B = ( Base ` A ) $.
mdetralt.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` R ) $.
mdetralt.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. CRing ) $.
mdetralt.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
mdetralt.i $e |- ( ph -> I e. N ) $.
mdetralt.j $e |- ( ph -> J e. N ) $.
mdetralt.ij $e |- ( ph -> I =/= J ) $.
mdetralt.eq $e |- ( ph -> A. a e. N ( I X a ) = ( J X a ) ) $.
mdetralt $p |- ( ph -> ( D ` X ) = .0. ) $.
$d I a $.
$d J a $.
$d N a $.
$d X a $.
